full_text: Case 1:20-cr-00330-AJN Document 763 Filed 08/10/22 Page 64 of 197 2605 LCHVMAX2 Young - direct 1 AMANDA YOUNG, called as a witness by the Defendant, having been duly sworn, testified as follows: THE COURT: All right. Thank you. Ms. Menninger, when you're ready, you may inquire. MS. MENNINGER: Thank you, your Honor. DIRECT EXAMINATION BY MS. MENNINGER: Q. Good morning, Ms. Young. A. Good morning. Q. You are the case agent assigned to this criminal case; correct? A. Yes, I'm one of the case agents. Q. One of the case agents. And when were you assigned to this case? A. At the end of 2018. Q. And you have been present here in the courtroom for the majority of the trial testimony, right? A. Yes, I have. Q. You just heard the testimony of Special Agent Richards; correct? A. Yes. Q. And would you agree with the testimony that he gave in regards to the methods of training for taking notes in preparing FBI 302s? SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C. (212) 805-0300 DOJ-OGR-00016793

1 AMANDA YOUNG, called as a witness by the Defendant, having been duly sworn, testified as follows: THE COURT: All right. Thank you. Ms. Menninger, when you're ready, you may inquire. MS. MENNINGER: Thank you, your Honor. DIRECT EXAMINATION BY MS. MENNINGER: Q. Good morning, Ms. Young. A. Good morning. Q. You are the case agent assigned to this criminal case; correct? A. Yes, I'm one of the case agents. Q. One of the case agents. And when were you assigned to this case? A. At the end of 2018. Q. And you have been present here in the courtroom for the majority of the trial testimony, right? A. Yes, I have. Q. You just heard the testimony of Special Agent Richards; correct? A. Yes. Q. And would you agree with the testimony that he gave in regards to the methods of training for taking notes in preparing FBI 302s?
